Annotation.String: This action is used to commit all applicable image components into storage.
This action shall commit all applicable image components into storage. This action cannot be executed when firmware update or background copy policy is enabled and in progress by ERoTs.
An array of URIs that indicate which image components commit into storage.

This parameter shall contain zero or more URIs that indicate which image components commit into storage. These targets shall correspond to SoftwareInventory resources. If this parameter is not present or contains no targets, the service shall apply to all applicable targets as determined by the service.
This version was created to improve the descriptions of CommitImage action.
This version was created to add a link to PersistentStorage resource.
The link to the persistent storage resource.
This property shall contain a link to a resource of type PersistentStorage.
The options for MultipartHttpPushUri-provided firmware updates.
This property shall contain options and capabilities of the service for MultipartHttpPushUri-provided firmware updates.
The client can request an UpdateOption parameter when using the URI specified by the `MultipartHttpPushUri` property to push firmware images.

This property shall indicate that a client can request an UpdateOption parameter when using the URI specified by the `MultipartHttpPushUri` property to push firmware images and service shall allow one of the values in this array for the UpdateOption parameter. If this property is present and the UpdateOption parameter is absent when pushing the firmware images, the default is `StageAndActivate`.
The update parameters used with `MultipartHttpPushUri` firmware update.
This type shall contain the update parameters when using the URI specified by the `MultipartHttpPushUri` property to push firmware images.
The requested update option when using the URI specified by the `MultipartHttpPushUri` property to push firmware images.

This property shall contain a requested update option when using the URI specified by the `MultipartHttpPushUri` property to push firmware images. If this property is absent, the default is `StageAndActivate`.
Transfer the provided firmware images to the non-volatile storage of the target devices without activation.

This value shall indicate the provided firmware images should be transferred to the non-volatile storage of the target devices without activation. When this value is requested, the newly transferred firmware images shall not be consumed by the devices.
Transfer the provided firmware images to the non-volatile storage of the target devices followed by the ActivateFirmware command defined in the PLDM for Firmware Update Specification.

This value shall indicate the provided firmware images should be transferred to the non-volatile storage of the target devices followed by the ActivateFirmware command defined in the PLDM for Firmware Update Specification. If the provided firmware images had been staged on the target devices previously, the firmware images shall not be transferred to the devices additionally.
